snippet: Concern is growing that the work of the commission that was created to end corruption in Albany is being compromised.
abstract: Editorial warns New York State's Commission to Investigate Public Corruption, also known as the Moreland Commission, could become little more than a branch of Gov Andrew Cuomo's political network; holds independence of committee, and its ability to help end state's scandal epidemic, will be compromised, if not wholly sabotaged, if Gov Cuomo or members of his staff tell the commissioners what to do and what not to do.
lead_paragraph: Concern is growing that the work of the commission that was created to end corruption in Albany is being compromised.

headline.main: Will New York’s Political Watchdog Pass the Test?
headline.print_headline: Will New York’s Political Watchdog Pass the Test?
